channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Seva Teerth: How PM Modi’s new office stands apart from South Block
Can BNP’s Tarique Rahman protect Hindus in Bangladesh?
Kathy Ruemmler resigns from Goldman Sachs over Epstein files. Who is the ex-Obama aide?
Do Indians read? The big question after UK publication disses India’s lit culture
What's Brazil’s new law inspired by loyal dog that stayed by its owner's grave for 10 years?
Seychelles chikungunya outbreak: Is it safe to travel to this beach destination?
How Islamists are the real winners in Bangladesh
item.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party may have won the 2026 election, but with the Jamaat rising to take the principal opposition position, the real victory has been for the Islamists

item.title: How Saudi Arabia’s embrace of ‘Axis of Ikhwan’ shatters the IMEC dream
item.description: Mohammed Bin Salman might keep the illusion of participation open—all the better to play into the wishful thinking of the West that does not want to acknowledge the loss of Saudi Arabia—but India should be under no illusion

item.title: Dealing with China: Why trade and Kailash Yatra should be India’s opening move before LAC settlement
item.description: A simpler first step for an India-China reset could be to reopen the frontiers as they were in the 1950s, particularly for trade and the Kailash-Manasarovar pilgrimage, following the centuries-old tradition

item.title: PM Modi’s Kuala Lumpur visit: India’s ties with Malaysia enter a comprehensive strategic phase
item.description: A total of 10 agreements were signed between the two countries, covering diverse areas including disaster management, combating corruption, semiconductors, and UN peacekeeping operations

item.title: Epstein’s death homicide or suicide? Latest DoJ files deepen mystery
item.description: Newly released interviews of an inmate and two guards present during Jeffrey Epstein’s death and the differences in the DoJ and FBI analyses of footage raise serious questions

item.title: Bangladesh polls: Why India should watch Jamaat’s resurgence closely
item.description: Jamaat’s return to the centre of electoral politics signals a new and potentially volatile chapter in the country’s political development — one whose implications will be felt well beyond Bangladesh
